name: Wallet with One account per dapp
description: build a wallet that does one account per dapp and makes send-to-others and send-to-self go through a pool by default

description: minimal LoC ethereum wallet

name: full code supply chain verification
description: How do you know that the thing you're running that claims to have some guarantees actually has those guarantees
author: https://x.com/VitalikButerin

name: Permissionless private prediction markets
description: Permissionless private prediction markets
author: https://twitter.com/web3privacy

name: hide-my-address aliases
description: hide-my-address aliases for sign-ins; similar to emails, you use a random address for sign-in that is tied to your main wallet address in a zk-way
author: https://twitter.com/pcaversaccio

name: What you leak data
description: can be a browser extension to start with that shows and warns each user whenever he interacts with a certain website, tool etc. what he currently leaks. People will get annoyed after a while but might also understand what they constantly leak
author: https://twitter.com/pcaversaccio

name: private academic peer review system
description: Submissions and feedback are encrypted, and decrypted once a threshold of reviewers have submitted their input. (can use threshold encryption e.g. via Shutter API). private state: reviews, reviewer identity
author: https://x.com/bezzenberger

name: threshold-secured contact discovery
description: Contacts are encrypted. Discovery (e.g., “do we both know Alice?”) requires threshold approval, preserving privacy. (can use threshold encryption e.g. via Shutter API, or more complext FHE/MPC scheme). private state: contact lists, shared contacts
author: https://x.com/bezzenberger

name: dark pool DEX with VBB-obfuscated re-encryption
description: FHE-encrypted trading with an iO-obfuscated proxy re-encryption program replacing trusted decryption parties. Users prove access and receive re-encrypted results without exposing keys or logic. Private state: encrypted orders, balances
author: https://x.com/bezzenberger

name: p2p music file share over a mixnet
description: p2p music file share over a mixnet
author: https://x.com/hxrts

name: trust based credit with private payments
description: a service that combines trust based credit with private payments, ie: any user can apply for a non-collateralized credit line and if it’s granted, they can then send up to the max amount of free credit to a new, anon wallet of which nobody knows they control it. from there they can then transact anonymously in order to apply for credit you have to show some onchain score, lets say for simplicity your gitcoin passport score
author: https://x.com/heckerhut

name: Proof of liveness (ZK client side) - Aka Proof of human
description: IDs and image vectors. Proof of liveness that works directly on the user's device and is able to generate a liveness proof (verifiable on-chain) without specialized hardware, or need to share biometrics to external servers. Client side ZK-image recognition is required by Rarimo.
author: https://x.com/LashaAntadze

name: private trustlines
description: A private version of the original trustlines network idea: A decentralized payment system that enables users to create mutual credit lines with trusted peers, facilitating transactions through interconnected networks of trust relationships without requiring traditional banking infrastructure.  Private state: connections, capacities and transfers should be private
author: https://x.com/_czepluch

name: private event planning
description: You should be able to sign up for events as easily as with luma, but you shouldn't get spammed by random projects because you shared your email or other information after. Using the zupass API to create a luma experience that is fully private! Private state: user information
author: https://x.com/_czepluch

name: Blinded Tokens
description: There should be a template of how to engage with a contract in order to exchange coins for a set of https://privacypass.github.io/ blinded tokens, that can be later used to access a service without linking back to which users/authorization is making the access Private state: who got the tokens
author: https://x.com/willscott

name: Private Social Media
description: Re-think family and friends oriented social media in a form where you can keep in touch with your loved ones while keeping control on your data. Private State: photos, updates.
author: https://x.com/fryorcraken

name: Idea Marketplace
description: A public forum where ideas are truly judged on their merit and not their author. Where reputation and algorithmic filtering are not based on agreement but acknowledged quality. Private State: identity and correlation.
author: https://x.com/fryorcraken

name: Private email recovery
description: ProtonMail stores users' recovery emails in plaintext, and recently had to hand over an activist's recovery email (iCloud) to the Spanish authorities. Instead, it could store some seeded hash of the recovery email, send the seed to the recovery email, and require a zkEmail proof to prove knowledge of preimage + control of the recovery email. Private state: plaintext recovery email address
author: https://x.com/therealyingtong

name: verifiably ephemeral messenger
description: Person sends a message - you read it. Message exists for a day and with verifiable computation (maybe a TEE?). You can prove there is no stored metadata or data on either device
author: https://x.com/_wjth

name: Private & verifiable edits in ProofMode
description: The ProofMode app does not seem to natively support photo edits (e.g. cropping, rotation). Let's integrate a zk image editor (e.g. https://github.com/Sofianel5/zk-img-editor) with ProofMode, to get private verifiable edits private state: original photograph
author: https://x.com/therealyingtong

name: Private & verifiable eDiscovery
description: eDiscovery is a multi-billion dollar industry, but often requires organisations to hand over their data to a third-party service (which may not always be GDPR complaint). Instead, organisations could verifiably run the software client-side and produce a zk proof that they did so correctly. private state: org database
author: https://x.com/therealyingtong

name: Make some noise
description: Automated program that sends small amount of funds back and forth between addresses owned or trusted by you, so that bad actors cannot tell if a particular address is actually related to you. Timing (~geographic) analysis is also foiled. It's like the anti-tracker plugin, Make Some Noise, that opens random web pages so your profile is garbase to trackers
author: https://x.com/ml_sudo

name: Privacy-focused Cryptozombies
description: An interactive tutorial to show people where they leak data as they transact
author: https://x.com/ml_sudo

name: Anonimity sets based on a real-world use-cases
description: Real-world use-cases using huge anonimity sets (anon groups)

name: Mpc or Fhe on-chain primitives (e.g., float32)
author: https://x.com/web3privacy

name: Encrypted Group Chat with Onchain Permissions
description: A  Signal-like UX with onchain-controlled access and membership gating — perfect for DAOs, squads, or gated alpha groups. Private state: membership lists, messages, channel keys
author: https://x.com/crispzlegiony

name: Private DeFi Positions
description: Traders want to hide their alpha. Enable them to take positions without exposing strategies to the mempool or competitors. Private state:  LP positions, leveraged trades, P&L

description: Private batch/multi-send transaction (so being able to send payment to many people at once privately) this could be for payroll

name: HW wallet based password manager
description: password manager that encrypts each password with a different key. The encryption/decryption is faciliatated by a hardware wallet (Trezor, Ledger, Jade), possibly using their GPG support

name: Encrypted facial recognition
description: Private and encrypted facial recognition for building access cameras (local non-Internet system)

name: Private indexer

name: Totally anon public forum
description: with selective disclosure for linking selected prev sent messages

name: Anon blogs
description: resilient pseudo or anon publishing hosting for blogs - can you have a NoBlogs that is hosted on IPFS / something resilient for e.g. anarcho orgs.
author: https://x.com/web3privacy

name: Unstoppable meme board
description: The page list latest meme and potentially attached comments. Meme can be curated, preferably using zero-knowledge technology for anonymous yet on-chain backed curation
author: https://x.com/web3privacy

name: 23 and only me
description: Upload DNA profile and store privately in cloud. Analysis tools run under MPC to deliver insights with maximum privacy guarantees
author: https://x.com/web3privacy

name: Privacy-focused home security
description: Privacy-focused/local-first home security
author: https://x.com/web3privacy

name: Tor RPC for Ethereum
description: a localhost service which exposes normal node RPC and relays it through tor. user should be able to just put localhost/smth in their RPC and use their wallet normally b) a listener implemented as a tor hidden service, which relays the calls to the node caveats
author: https://x.com/web3privacy

name: Split-signing injective wallet for Ethereum.
description: normal wallet, such as metamask, which, upon prompting a transaction, will expose an unsigned tx (through system output, or, optionally, as a string that can be copied / QR code)
author: https://x.com/web3privacy

name: Pamphlet Generator
description: A tool allowing designers to publish templates for pamhplets, stickers, zines etc. on a decentralized storage (e.g. Codex). The app will allow for downlaoding the design package, fill in the template with custom information and export assets in easily printable format. The goal is to help event/meetup organizers to get quickly to high quality materials without relying on centralized services like Figma.
author: https://x.com/vpavlin
